website_summaries.verdict: Kids love honing their sight word skills with this fast-moving game.
pros: Kids swat at fly-shaped cards decorated with common sight words
Comes with 110 two-sided fly cards based on the top 220 Dolch sight words
These words appear frequently in children's books
Comes with 4 swatters for multi-player fun
cons: Reading levels and cards could be organized better

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! My son enjoyed them
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! My son enjoyed them. Different colors for different levels. They are 2-sided & you are given a good amount of words.
customer_reviews.author: K-u-r-s-h

customer_reviews.title: Good learning tool
customer_reviews.text: This has been awesome helping my littles learn sight words. The biggest issue is the flies have sight words on the front and back. It makes it difficult following the sight word list from my child’s teacher when two words are on the same fly. I separated each list of words into sandwich bags and just use handmade Cards, but it would be helpful if they included a few blank flies.
customer_reviews.author: Estellar Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 5 year old boy just learning reading concepts
customer_reviews.text: So far we are enjoying it. I play this effectively on ‘single player’ with my son. Because he is so prone to just guess I quickly came up with the rule that he goes first but if he guesses I get the turn to swat. With each word we quickly talk about clues ton sounding out the word. He’s pretty excited about hitting the cards. I think I may include some kind of prize box for successfully beating me 10 times - just to keep it rewarding for him. We enjoy it and it’s built well.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I wish this was more fun, but without an audio box saying the words ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish this was more fun, but without an audio box saying the words out loud it's hard to play with 2 people. We say "if you know a word, hit it" The kids do like the hitting part.
customer_reviews.author: TXMama

customer_reviews.title: My class LOVES this game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is great! My Kindergarten class LOVES it! It's a fun fast paced way to build sight word fluency. The materials seem to be well made and are holding up to daily use after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game to start early & advance sight words!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1st & 4th grader and they LOVED playing this game!!! It's nice that the levels are color coded and the fly cards & the swatters both are made well and are not flimsy. I sent this to my daughters 1st grade class for a few weeks and the teacher & kids enjoyed it and everything came back still intact!! I just wish I had found this sooner but we still have 2 more grade levels to work with. Great game for the price & a big help with learning sight words while still having fun!!
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves this game because she gets to wack the flies. I love it because she’s learning her words while also having fun.
customer_reviews.author: Lawyer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Fun and motivating game for new readers
customer_reviews.text: I have been having trouble getting my five year old interested in learning to read even though he knows all of his letters and letter sounds and loves being read to. This is a fun way to introduce sight words. He loves "racing" to hit the word faster than myself or my husband. I can make it as hard to easy as it needs to be while he gets familiar with the words. We started with just a couple and have slowly added more. There are many words and they are color coded by difficulty level. All in all infinitely more fun than flash cards.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kindergartners love these! And it helps them learn their sight words- win, win :-)
customer_reviews.author: All About Comfort

customer_reviews.title: kids love this
customer_reviews.text: they love the fly swatter only complaint I have is you cant really sort out the colors they are all different on the back since there are 5 colors for levels in other words if I sort out the purple I cant sort out red or orange because its all mixed in on the other side,,, By the way picture is not accurate both sides are colored no B&W
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to learn sight words.
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! Although, I don't actually use it as intended. I am a preschool teacher and my children in my class are too young to learn sight words so I turned them into color identification, numbers, letters, and even Spanish. I use colored painters tape over the word and my children LOVE it. It is a great game for teaching a variety of lessons if your creative in your teaching. I imagine that it would be so much fun for kindergarteners to learn their sight words.
customer_reviews.author: Luxi

customer_reviews.title: Can make it at home with notecards...
customer_reviews.text: Eh...I’m not sure this should be a retail game. You put out the flash cards (bugs) and the adult calls out the words they see. The kid finds them. Had I know it was that basic - I could have written the words on nice notecards and just made this ourselves. But my daughter does enjoy it. So thanks for the idea!? Definitely buy this on sale and not at full price
customer_reviews.author: QMegz

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Students really enjoy this game. Great for stations, small group etc. Each color is a different level, so to help 7 year olds remember is to actually color code the word SWAT!
customer_reviews.author: guadalupe

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for primary classrooms!
customer_reviews.text: My first graders love this game! It works best with students with similar abilities but my advanced readers love to be the callers. Excellent quality and lots of words. Despite what the directions say (up to 3rd grade level), these are all beginning sight words thus the four-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: J A Shaw

customer_reviews.title: wonderful tool for learning
customer_reviews.text: These cards are colorful and make learning fun. I created a game where if my grandson *6* gets both sides right, he keeps the card. If he doesn't, I keep the card. Whoever has the most cards at the end gets to pick a PBS kids show. TV motivated him. We used the swatters at first, but then created the new game.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I knew about this sooner
customer_reviews.text: This is the most fun reading game there is. You will crack up while playing this game. Just watch out while trying to eliminate the flies because you can get your hands smacked. It makes learning to read very competitive and fun. Be warned that your child may never want to stop playing. It also gradually goes from easy words to harder words. So it can grow as your child learns. Makes a great gift. The flies were larger then I expected. The fly swatter are heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Jose and Pa-ti

customer_reviews.title: Great learning game!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this game! I saw someone share this game on a homeschool page and thought I’d try it out. My daughter LOVES it! Sometimes and adult will play with her or sometimes I mix it up and see how many she can get in a certain amount of time since she’s the only kid. We haven’t played with other children but I’m sure she would enjoy it better that way! It’s a good way to introduce new sight words as well. Really a great learning game!
customer_reviews.author: TXShell

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not great.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased several sight word games for our daughter in Kindergarten. This is by far her least favorite and requires a lot of set-up at the beginning. It also doesn't have many of the words most schools teach in K and 1st grade. We're outside the returning time frame so it's ours now but I would recommend other games we purchased over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 year old son and 3 year old daughter absolutely love this game!!! It has helped grow their vocabulary in more ways than one. I definitely recommend this for any Kindergarten child. Helps build confidence in both the parent and the child. Learning will occur!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gilman

customer_reviews.title: The kids love this game!
customer_reviews.text: The best way to learn something is to make it enjoyable. The kids compete to say the sight word first, they laugh and squeal with delight as they swat the flies containing the sight words. They ask to play the game and have no idea they're learning something while playing. We even take a break from virtual school to play a quick game *if* they get all their work done in a subject without complaint... 😀. Bliss!
customer_reviews.author: still learning

customer_reviews.title: its a fun game, our kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: BUT the words are supposed to be ranked by difficulty but we feel it not consistent or well thought out. many large words are the same color as simple sight words
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kerkhoven

customer_reviews.title: Concept is good storage is bad
customer_reviews.text: Like the concept. Dislike how the game is stored. It needs to come with a better way to keep the “bugs”
customer_reviews.author: Brittany E.

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Birthday gift for a 5 year old boy learning his sight words. His mom says he and his 6 year old sister love to play it with her. Win!
customer_reviews.author: love dogs

customer_reviews.title: Great fun with word learning
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr old loves playing this game. The sight word cards are big enough and clear enough to read. She likes the silly faces on them and the various colors, red blue green orange purple, color coded by difficultly. Seems to follow the Dulch word list. Double sided bugs, good quality on both sides. Helps her recognize words quicker, hand eye coordination, learning how to follow rules of a game, and sportsmanship (sometimes she isn’t the first to win the card). We learn the words with video and flashcards then later play this game to strengthen her recall.
customer_reviews.author: Vhendi

customer_reviews.title: Great learning resource!
customer_reviews.text: My kindergartner loves this game and it is definitely helping her learn her sight words! The fly swatters don't feel very strong, but we will see how they hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBleu

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for Homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: My Kindergartner, who is being homeschooled this year, LOVES this game. We pull it out once a week for a fun little sight word game. She is just learning, but being able to interact with the words really helps and makes it fun. The game is really well made, words are thick and sturdy. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: suztothee

customer_reviews.title: Educational and fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old to incorporate into our homeschooling plans. So far he loves it and is engaged. We've only had it for a few days now and I'm seeing improvement in his reading skills. I'm certain this game has something to do with that. It has differed colored flies for different age levels. It even has contractions. I'm definitely impressed with it and the quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Multi leveled
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be a lot of fun. We played it with about half the lowest, blue level words and my 5 year old twins loved it. I'm planning to blu-tak about 10 words on the wall near our trampoline and see how it goes. But getting to hit something as part of a game is great fun for 5 year olds.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun sight word activity!
customer_reviews.text: My students love this game. The one thing I don’t like is I can’t group and store the words by level because they are two sided. Because of that, it takes a while to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: FUN
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun. My kids are always having a laugh at us trying to kill flies that come around during the summer season. This was a great purchase. We play with 10-15 flies at a time when calling them out. When we use flash cards, we dump them all out and whoever swats 5 wins.
customer_reviews.author: Nala.

customer_reviews.title: My kids are obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: My son is dyslexic and this game has helped him so much! The words are color coded by their difficulty so it’s easy to pick the words that he’s mastered already and the words we need to work on. It’s been so difficult to try to get him to be interested in spelling and this game has boosted his confidence 100% and it’s really fun! My daughter who is in Kindergarten is learning how to spell and read as well!
customer_reviews.author: mgh

customer_reviews.title: A hit with my 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this game and it realy helps him learn his sight words. He likes th he gets to swat at the words! It a huge variety of words too and fo different levels! I'd definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my 5yr old. We absolutely love it! Its helping her build her confidence about ready!!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Mizanoski

customer_reviews.title: Fun and great quality
customer_reviews.text: This game is not only fun for the kids but it is also a great quality! The pieces are very sturdy and good size so I have no doubt it will last through all of my daycare children! This game comes with 120 double sided thick word cards and 4 heavy duty plastic swatters.
customer_reviews.author: N.M.

customer_reviews.title: Best learning game I’ve gotten so far!
customer_reviews.text: My kids have been struggling with sight words so I got this game for them. It has so many words and I like how they are color codes based off leavels. The cards are thick and durable and the kids had a blast! They asked to play over and over.
customer_reviews.author: christy

customer_reviews.title: Great educational game!
customer_reviews.text: Overall we love this game. It Is perfect for a fun educational tool! I did remove one star though because this would’ve been even better if it had a list of the sight words so that I don’t have to just look at the bugs to yell out words to my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Making learning fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play with my 4 and 5 year old. Teaching sight words can be difficult, but things like this make those tricky words fun. My kids really enjoy this and the swatting. They don’t even realize we are learning and reinforcing knowledge. Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Onelove

customer_reviews.title: Teaches kids words fast
customer_reviews.text: Kids learn words in game form easily. Easy to play and fun. Kis love the race to see who can hit the word 1st. Even if kids don't recognize words yet pointing and calling out the word before hand helps and still let's the kids have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Raena

customer_reviews.title: Good for small group
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old love this! It would be a great game for a small group Because you really need at least 3 people to play(2 players and someone to call out words) Wish they had an app or something to call out the words
customer_reviews.author: MAGAGroup

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game for Sight Words
customer_reviews.text: This is such a FUN game for kids learning Sight Words. Perfect for Kindergarten students, but helpful for preschool ages too. I love the different optional levels and the quality of the cards. The swatters are the kids favorite. Family Fun and Learning!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product/highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I work with school aged children. They use this game all the time. They love swatting their site words with the swatters. There are tons of cards and they are all double sided, so it includes ALOT of words!! Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy White

customer_reviews.title: Makes learning fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game for my kindergartener, and he loves it. The sight word cards are thick and durable. The cards are double sided and color coded for different level words. He really enjoyed the game, and it made learning fun!
customer_reviews.author: oleary

customer_reviews.title: Great sight word game for young kids learning to read
customer_reviews.text: My 6 yr old is in kindergarten and learning how to read. He gets very bored of reading his sight words on flash cards. He loves playing this game and doesn't realize he's learning or doing school work so its a win win!!! there are so many different levels for him to advance to as well. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and learning!
customer_reviews.text: 14 years of homeschooling and I still love finding fun learning games. I bagged up the words in smaller more manageable blocks so we just do a few at a time. The 6 year old LOVES swatting words!
customer_reviews.author: Kristens_on_vacation

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational Game
customer_reviews.text: This game is great and a fun way for kids to work on sight words. I am a sped teacher and have used it with many students of varying grade levels. It is a great fast paced game and we switch it up sometimes with asking students to find a rhyming word, word with a special digraph, or beginning/ending sound. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ratzy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our speech delayed 5year old. Hes beginning kindergarten work (we homeschool) and this has been an amazing way to teach words sounds, blends and sight word practice. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Lankey

customer_reviews.title: perfect for learning site words but the fly swatters need to be stronger
customer_reviews.text: Our kids love playing this game and it's been beneficial in learning the site words in a fun way. Our only complaint is the swatters bend and eventually break overtime. Our kids are not rough with the swatters either. We wish they sold replacements. We've duct taped them all back together but we wish the material was a bit stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It is fun to play with my 5-year old niece
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my little niece. She is 5 now, and she has a list of words to learn from kindergarten. I picked out those words, and we only play with those for now. There are plenty of words we could add later. It's actually kind of fun. She likes it. I also like the quality of the words. They will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: MonicaL

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining way to learn sight words
customer_reviews.text: My 1st grader was struggling to learn his sight words. He also had problems paying attention, but this game kept him entertained! This game is more entertaining and a better alternative to flashcards.
customer_reviews.author: tinar2007

customer_reviews.title: Great game for all kids
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 6 year old to help with sight words. A great interactive learning game with different grade levels. Very good quality and the kids have a great time swatting. Helps with spelling and reading. A great teacher gift too!
customer_reviews.author: kmoose

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for young readers! I love that it has a variety of levels (beginner and up). Its perfect for homeschooling also! It is a fun way to learn and reinforce reading skills!
customer_reviews.author: Josephgo

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit!
customer_reviews.text: Using this to homeschool Pre-K little bit! He loves this game. Learning his letters very quickly, and loves being able to swat the bee's. Highly recommend. Would make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: PreD

customer_reviews.title: Fun educational game
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun for my little learner. It is separated by different levels (colors) of flys. Which is nice if your a teacher, you can differentiate really easy. My almost four year old is working on a couple of sight words and LOVES this game.
customer_reviews.author: Amber M.

customer_reviews.title: Such a good game!
customer_reviews.text: I have played this multiple times with my Kindergartner and it does help her start to recognize more sight words. I really love this and recommend for all children learning to read!
customer_reviews.author: Sammi

customer_reviews.title: Great for My 3 Year Old - Colors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my soon-to-be 4 year old. He is too young to recognize the sight words yet, but I knew I wanted this game for learning in the next year, so right now we play swat the “color.” He LOVES it. I call out a color and then we try and swat as many of that color as fast as we can and you get to keep the ones you swat. Whoever has the most, wins! He will be so excited once he starts recognizing words in this game and can play with more than just colors.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Gracia

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun game for little ones that are trying to learn ...
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game for little ones that are trying to learn their sight words. It’s always great when you can trick them in to learning ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: slaptistic
customer_reviews.text: Great educational game. We learn sight words and then play this. Just make sure you tell your kiddo to stop slapping when you try to pick up the word.... ouch. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Liana

customer_reviews.title: Great for your younger and older children.
customer_reviews.text: My boys are excited about this product. It is going to make learning sight words more fun. There are so many words included in various difficulties, this is perfect for my pre-K child AND my 1st grader. With the same product I can strengthening their reading skills.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old struggles with dyslexia and this game has been super helpful. She struggles with learning to read and with sight words. This has made it more enjoyable for her.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lash

customer_reviews.title: Double sided fail.
customer_reviews.text: Not convenient when your child is learning sight words on both sides. Double sided was not a good idea. Quality is just okay. It’s really not a “game” as you just swat the word.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Cute, fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: I have a pre-k and 3rd grader and they absolutely love this game. My 4 yr old feels like she's doing something mature while my 3rd grader works on his sight words. Super cute, fun and educational! You definitely want this for your young readers!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is so fun but I wish I had more kids my sons age to play with him because its a speed game. We play together but I have to pretend to find them faster.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a bunch of sight words printed on flies and 4 fly swatters. Fun and educational. My kids like this game a lot. Good price for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Peanut jelly and butter

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Sight Word Game
customer_reviews.text: Students love to play this game. Sometimes I borrow the fly swatters and have them slap different words or math facts. I would prefer if they were only single sided as it would make it easier to play with only the words students still need to practice.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Fun sight word game
customer_reviews.text: My class love these and it’s a fun way to practice sight words! Also works on a range of kids from k-3 or 4th so I have loaned it out. All the kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer k.

customer_reviews.title: Great, fun game for learning
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 5 and loves this game. There are so many words and levels of difficulty so we will be able to use this for several years with her. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Missing pieces this item must have been a return and was shipped to me because pieces are missing and it’s useless for my autistic daughter
customer_reviews.author: carla w.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son and he loves it! and I like that it has different grade sight words. It makes him want to learn them so he can beat who he plays against.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Makes sight word practice easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game hoping to make sight word practice a little easier for my daughter. Much to my surprise she requests to play this game and it has made practicing her sight words so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME little game!
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy playing this for homeschool morning circle time & rainy days! Bright, colorful & well made! Highly recommend! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
customer_reviews.author: GMC

customer_reviews.title: Complicated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old son who was going to start kinder soon. I wanted something so that he can get familiar but this just wasn't it, at least not the way its made to be played. Also didn't like how it says their are different levels but it didn't say which color was which level. My advice is to buy this for kids who know their sight words already not to start introducing them. I
customer_reviews.author: haydee alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome game for children that are having reading difficulties. My daughter is dyslexic and behind a grade in her reading and comprehension. This game gives her the sharpness to strengthen her eye to brain skills. The fly swatting just makes the game fun and not such a "oh more learning drills" repetition to her.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving the overall quality of this product! There's 220 sight words. Up to third grade. This will definitely help build her reading skills. Retention and memory 💚The fly swatters are so cute and sturdy. My daughter giggled and laughed as she swatted the sight words on the fly cards. She loves it😊As with other products from Learning resources I've purchased, 4 1/2 years ago still holding up. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Felicia G

customer_reviews.title: ... wish they were not two sided otherwise they were great and loved by my students
customer_reviews.text: I wish they were not two sided otherwise they were great and loved by my students.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning game
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this game! It's perfect for kids around the same age or at least same level of reading/sight words to play together
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G.

customer_reviews.title: Great game and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for my first grade classroom. My only complaint is that the bugs are double sided with two different levels, so I can’t bag them according to level. They should have made both sides the same color.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It work works nice for me son. Wish they had some blank ones so could add other words he learning. He loves smacking it the bugs
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Great find.
customer_reviews.text: My 6 and 7 year old love this game. I was looking for a way to help my kids remember sight words. I have also given this to a couple of teachers to use in the classroom. I would highly recommend for pre-k through 2nd grade.
customer_reviews.author: Marvis Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and a great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: My child LOVES playing Swat! It’s a great way for children to learn sight words without having to ‘study’. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: Great learning game. Bought this for a friend's kid who is struggling with her sight words. She was really engaged in the game. She had fun swatting the sight word bugs with the fly swatter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: A great game to get your children learning while having fun. My daughter asks to play this game and she’s learning more sight words everyday.
customer_reviews.author: D. Walker

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game makes learning and reviewing sight words so much fun! My son is 4 years old and loves it. We have come up with various ways to play. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: Fun and educational way to learn sight words. I played it with a nine-year-old child from China that I am teaching English. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Endraske

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This has been a really fun way to learn sight words. My son LOVES it and has picked up the words quickly. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I bought three of these
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun way to learn sight words — beats skill and drill. Four can play, or a parent and child. I would rather the words were only on one side of the bugs. The color coding helps with deciding which words to share.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning game for the kidd0s
customer_reviews.text: Iam a homeschool mom, and this game is amazing for the kidd0s to learn there sight words. My kids love it & I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Zabe_party7

customer_reviews.title: Elementary school tutor
customer_reviews.text: I tutor at an elementary school. The teacher has really appreciated that I have brought this in
customer_reviews.author: Justin Plante

customer_reviews.title: Learning is fun
customer_reviews.text: This has made learning sight words easier. My boys love this game. It’s also easy to separate words by color so that it’s not as overwhelming for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Love books

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Sight Word Swat a Sight Word Game, Homeschool, Visual, Tactile and Auditory Learning, Phonics Games, 114 Pieces, Ages 5+
product_meta.description: Size:-Encourage kids to discover the 220 most commonly used sight words with this fun and fast-paced game. Specially designed to teach the top Dolch sight words, sight word SWAT challenges kids to see, SWAT, and learn! They’ll think they’re just playing, but parents and teachers will know they’re actually Learning. Set features various game instructions for 1-4 players. Includes 110 double-sided sight-word flies and 4 colorful swatters measuring 9”L each.
feature_bullets: EDUCATIONAL & ENGAGING: Build reading, spelling and vocabulary skills through playful competition with up to 4 players. The element of speed promotes confidence and fluency in reading.
GAMES FOR ELEMENTARY SCHOOL KIDS: The sight-word flies are color-coded by level: Blue for Pre-Primer; Red for Primer; Green for First Grade; Orange for Second Grade; and Purple for Third Grade.
EASY & FUN WAY TO LEARN & PLAY:: After one of the 220 Dolch sight words is called out, use your swatter to swat the word on the matching fly.
WHAT'S INCLUDED: Set includes 110 double-sided flies printed with the top 220 Dolch sight words, which are a selection of words found most frequently in children’s books.
GREAT FOR HOMESCHOOL OR CLASSROOM LEARNING: Homeschool supplies for ages 5+
